V.iii.12.C.1.a
.
Definition: MS
Multiple sclerosis
(MS) is a slowly progressive central nervous system disease, and is characterized by
disseminated patches of demyelination in the brain and spinal cord which cause multiple and varied neurologic symptoms and signs, and
the occurrence of remissions and exacerbations in the symptoms.
title: M21-1, Part V, Subpart iii, Chapter 12, Section C - Progressive Neurological Disorders
citation: Part V, Subpart iii, Chapter 12, Section C
